page.title: 13Highbrook - Farming
page.content: Much of the land is covered by woodland leaving clearings of grassland evenly scattered throughout the area. Most of these clearings are grazing land, occasionally ploughed and reseeded but more often left and grazed by sheep alone. Around Highbrook are a few fields grazed by dairy herds. These belong to the working farm in the village itself. Many fields are used by local affluent families for horses. To the south east are orchards of eating apples picked in autumn by local hired labour. The average size of field is unusually small because of the relief and delayed introduction of modern intensive farming techniques. Most hedgerows have been retained.
